title: Scribal abbreviation
summary: Scribal abbreviations or sigla (singular: siglum) are abbreviations used as a critical apparatus by ancient and medieval scribes writing in various languages, including Latin, Greek, Old English and Old Norse. In modern manuscript editing (substantive and mechanical) sigla are the symbols used to indicate the source manuscript (e.g. variations in text between different such manuscripts) and to identify the copyists of a work.
